website_summaries.verdict: While lacking the speed of other options, this moderately-priced router offers good coverage and handles heavy traffic well.
pros: Switch devices between bands with Smart Connect
Good range at a decent price
Comes with a USB 3.0 port and an app to manage and monitor your network
cons: Some buyers had problems with it frequently dropping both WiFi and WAN connections
Some of these stop working completely after several months

customer_reviews.title: What an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced our nine year old Linksys Wrt54gs router with the Asus acrh13 dual band router. It was fast and easy to connect. The wi-fi signal increased to cover our 3,600 square foot house entirely( The router is in the basement). The speed and capabilities are terrific for the price. The apps for Android and Apple allow for convenient management of the network from mobile devices. We have 22 devices and it handles traffic very well.
customer_reviews.author: G G

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase, Please read First or you will regret.
customer_reviews.text: After about 4-6 months, the 3.0.0.4 firmware will cause your router to basically drop your download speed from the avg for me (480 MBPS) down to (25 mbps) or less until you reboot your router. This is a known issue that is not disclosed and you wont get a warranty by the time the issue occurs. Do not buy this look for another product, I am now having to buy a different product. FYI if you are used to 25 download or less have it or if you need to game at high speeds, but then just use the router your provider gives you, this one is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: Poor Service. Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit since Nov 2017. It is now defective and trying to get assistance from ASUS is problematic. Spent 90 minutes on teh phone last night with "Maylyn" I had to hand the call over to my wife as I could not understand the rep. My wife equally had a problem but got through it. Supposed to get a call back today at 9AM. NO call. I did achat and the rep said they are working on it and it coudl take up to 48 hours to get addressed. I am going to buy a new different brand at Staples today as I cannot wait for these idiots. Poor, poor customer service!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn J. Carlyle

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This router has been amazing and I have never had to restart it. I have had some routers in the past which would freeze up after awhile. Also this router had some features which I found very useful, I talk more about this in my video review. I highly recommend this router and have recommend it to friends and family members.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Corinn

customer_reviews.title: Wifi keeps dropping!!!!
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought it was a good router. Signal is strong on both the 2ghz and 5ghz. Then i started noticing that the wifi keeps dropping. Performed firmware upgrades and changed settings. Wifi still drops every now and then for about a minute then comes back up. The router is good.......when the wifi is working but it gets really annoying when the wifi starts dropping. It is a known/common issue with this router and i have yet to find a fix that works. I might just end up buying a different router. I do not recommend this router!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Boy

customer_reviews.title: It's ASUS, it's cheap, and it has more gain than any other router in its class. Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Is this as good as the RT-AC68U? No. Is it better than pretty much anything else? Yes. Is it half the price of the competing LinkSys? YES. This thing punches through walls like nothing else. You'd have to be living in a Faraday cage for this not to work. It also runs ASUS's OS which is nice. It cannot run DD_WRT or Merlin, so you don't get the advanced features like VPN, but the hardware is capable. And there's at least one aftermarket OS that will run, although I haven't checked it out yet. Worked great for the application I needed, and it was like $75. Easy choice. ASUS rocks.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great option for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father. He's in a 2500 square foot ranch style home on a 1 gig fiber connection with 1 main desktop PC, some cameras, and a few wireless devices. The setup is the same as any other router you've ever used. I assume the instructions are ok? The wifi works everywhere in the house (2.4 & 5ghz). The DDNS service I use works. The VPN lets me onto his network like it should. It will run pretty close to his 1gig connection, but not on his 10/100 desktop he refuses to upgrade. I put a USB stick in it so he can backup boomer memes etc. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace the wifi signal of my Spectrum router. I am really pleased with the signal strength and wifi data transfer. My smart tv went from 3mb to 66mb transfer. My wireless desktop went from 90mb to 480mb ttansfer rate. It covers a 2000 sq ft home with converted garage. I can't see how anyone will be disappointed. Web interface is very detailed, and allows for intermediate to professional operation. Very good help menus and online assistance. I almost got a more expensive one, but this one is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi Router! Minor Disappointments...
customer_reviews.text: This router has drastically improved my home WiFi experience. Finally I am able to utilize 100% of my available bandwidth provided by my ISP. My only disappointments were finding out that some features shown on Asus's ASUSWRT details page do not appear to be available on this router. Missing features that I was looking forward to using include "Traffic Analyser - Statistics", "Adaptive QoS > Bandwidth Monitor", and "Adaptive QoS > Web History". I've checked and it appears that the router has the latest available firmware "3.0.0.4.380_6516" installed. If anyone knows how to find/enable the above features, I'd greatly appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Fine if yours works. Takes forever to reboot.
customer_reviews.text: Junk: latest firmware, no real changes on router. Worked great for a week but now drops the 5 GHz connection (as in: it's not there) multiple times a day. Only a reboot will fix it and not for very long. Google shows known issue with the 5 GHz chip. Router is not "hot". Maybe I just got a bad one, but returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wulf

customer_reviews.title: USB tethering works seamlessly!!!
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing. It just works. I bought this specifically for the USB tethering ability and it has worked flawlessly right off the bat. I had to contact ASUS support due to a login issue to get the router registered and that was also easy. Support was a real person who quickly helped me solve my issue. 100% pleased all around. I also have a large (3-story, 4k sqft) home and this provides adequate coverage to the whole place.
customer_reviews.author: Carebear

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router 4 months ago. After buying it I read some negative reviews and hoped my experience might be different, but -- alas -- it wasn't to be... It worked fine until today -- in fact, the wifi features still work -- but suddenly the 10/100/1000 ports just *stopped*. I rebooted the device and YES! IT"S WORKING AGAIN!! Then about ten minutes later -- UH-OH. IT'S NOT! Another reboot, and another half hour, then -- NOTHING through the ports. So now I'm using an old NETGEAR N150 for hard-wired connections and I guess I'll add the ASUS just for wifi...
customer_reviews.author: Frank_Lecanto

customer_reviews.title: Flawed hardware
customer_reviews.text: Great looking product, visually pleasing and thats’s about it. From a get go, it started dropping 5ghz, updated firmware to latest now after using it for few minutes it shuts off completely. You have to toggle power button to bring it back up and it lasts another 5 minutes. Maybe just this device is defective, I can’t take another chance by getting a replacement. Processing a return now. I wish it worked, now I have to run to Walmart as soon as they open to get a replacement since we have to work remote. Can’t afford to wait for amazon delivery for two days.
customer_reviews.author: Cenk

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than six months
customer_reviews.text: This unit did not see a lot of use. I bought it for work testing purposes and it has very few running hours on the unit. Switch/router appears to work but the wireless part of the unit has failed. I have four wireless routers in my house and I manage the network in a friends accounting office. I have four ASUS routers under my care and control. First time I have had to use ASUS support. As others have said, absolutely useless. Right now their support web site is 404 ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT!! No phone numbers, etc. Can't get an RMA. I will be looking elsewhere for routers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Watson

customer_reviews.title: Every room has a great signal now
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my home internet was at 200 speed but my original box didn't get up there plus the signal didn't reach beyond 2 rooms away. This unit now covers all the rooms of my 1900 sq ft home plus reaches out into the yard. Tip to buyers: Give the same name and password to both bands. That way any device you come into range with should come right up. I do not use the guest option but it's nice to know that is there. I am very pleased with this item. It is the most for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Just Over 9 months!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this router on 4/13/19 and it died 1/23/20. While working it was fine, no complaints. However, to have it repaired, I would have to send it back to manufacturer at my own expense and I would be without internet for at least 8 - 9 business days! In this day and age with so much reliance on the internet that is just ridiculous. Instead I purchased another brand router and hopefully won't experience another such short lifespan!
customer_reviews.author: Kehron Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use as wifi access point for FIOS fiber router. Turned off the FIOS wifi and connected the RT-ACRH13 to an ethernet port. Followed the setup process for the RT and no problem. Plenty of features for a home Updating the firmware was a challenge. Had to download it to a USB 2 drive from the ASUS website and then upload it to the RT like updating a BIOS on a motherboard. The 5G band begins to weaken at 20-25 feet even without any obstructions/walls. The 2G is much stronger and does better at going through walls in a ranch style house.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: The firmware is in Chinese.
customer_reviews.text: Router's login screen is a mix of Chinese and English. After a call to tech support that I shouldn't have had to make, they were able to assist me with logging in and getting rid of the kanji garbage all over the screen. The speed of the router is fine. This is the second router swap I have done on this internet connection. The first swap did not interrupt my connections to Netflix or Hulu. I am very disappointed in this product and would be returning it if I hadn't waited so long to hook it up. I will no longer be purchasing any ASUS products.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dauma and Brianne Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our Asus router for 8 months so far and it's been issue free. I wasn't quite ready to step up to a high end router and this Asus model was just the right price for us. We are able to get both the 5.0 and 2.4 ghz signals all over our townhouse and the interface is super easy to figure out. After years of fighting with crappy Netgear routers this has been a great experience. Very little drop in wifi speed as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing router. Reaches full speed from cable box, no loss of quality.
customer_reviews.text: This was probably one of the best purchases I ever made tech wise. We were having issues with our net being slow with so many devices connected, and also not reaching everywhere in our home. Since we got this router we have almost zero issues. Speeds are always as fast as plugging into the actual cable box and will reach to the opposite end of my house. I always tell my tech friends about how good this product is. Only downside is their login portal to access the router. It never seems to connect properly the first couple tries, and for a beginner the interface could be a bit daunting. I love it though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: worst router ive ever owned
customer_reviews.text: the web based interface only works with firefox and the wifi only seems to work correctly with new high end devices like the Samsung galaxy s8. Anything lower end like a chromebook or a cheaper samsung tablet, the signal drops randomly. Very dissapointing considering its an asus product
customer_reviews.author: scott tobin

customer_reviews.title: I trust this more than TP-Link although it's not the fastest
customer_reviews.text: Wifi coverage is pretty decent definitely 20-30% better than the Verizon G1100. The bandwidth is more than enough for average homes unless you are getting gigabit connection, in that case usually your ISP will give you a router rental for free. This router has all the functions that I need and it's running smoothly. It's been in the market for 3 years so it's very reliable. If you are looking for a router that doesn't drop you out all the time and restart itself many times a day, this is the one you should get. It's made in Taiwan and I'm pretty sure the quality is gonna be better than those Made in China routers.
customer_reviews.author: tomR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product, works perfectly fine
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for almost a year now and I'm very satisfied with it. With my old router, I'd have to restart it every once in a while because it would get slow or not connect at all. This has been a great router with good coverage in the entire house (2/1 condo, 1100 sqft). When we're all home and using our devices, this thing can be connected to 10+ devices (iPhones, tablets, laptops, Roku) and they all work well.
customer_reviews.author: Sep

customer_reviews.title: Signal is not as strong as described
customer_reviews.text: I have a house only 1200sqft but 3 stories while 3rd with comps in two rooms and down stairs for camera while it sits in living room. It’s strong in living room, well, only 20 ft away from it, so it should be good, and then down stairs for the camera was ok, only the 3rd floor, basically 1 comp directly above the router was good signal, then one comp which is 15ft from that comp, 4/5 most of the time, and one in next room, basically 2/5 and best would be 5/5 but rarely, and then the Mbps got screwed up, luckily I use ASUS router before, and used the old one as repeater
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Substantial Performance for the Cost
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaced an Apple Extreme in my home. Peak speed is a bit better and overall throughput is good. I use this with Xfinity 500mbs advertised service, which this unit handles effectively. Overall covers most of my 2700 square food home. I may try changing the position to optimize. Interface is good enough, but some things are less intuitive. Changing some settings requires a reboot, which can be annoying. Only issue I had was with WPS, which is an older and less secure method to connect devices. The router suggested "success," however the device never connected this way. Firmware updates (two so far) have been straight forward and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Craft Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Management
customer_reviews.text: Alot of home routers I've used have a clunky and sluggish web interface. This one was refreshingly responsive and clean. I was able to connect to the WIFI within moments of powering it on just following the guide. I changed the admin password, and set SSIDs/passwords for both signals(the 2ghz and 5 ghz). Of course changing the SSIDs caused me to be disconnected, but the management interface shows you a page just before being disconnected advising you to reconnect with the new SSIDs. I have a longish house with 1600sq feet and it covers the entire house easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought 2
customer_reviews.text: The router works great! Vpn Support for openVPN :) and PPTP with client and server, note:: that a kill switch option was not present (not a factor for me). Tested on local network to get full gigabit speed on Ethernet , can't verify wan only have a ~20 Mbps down. SSH capabilities work fine. Only issue was port forwarding (or pin-holes) are located in WAN tab and not firewall section (not sure why but once I read the manual was able to figured it out). Wished I had gotten two when on sale ah well :\
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bluemner

customer_reviews.title: After 1 month of use it is constantly dropping connection ...
customer_reviews.text: After 1 month of use it is constantly dropping connection and needs restarted at least once a week. I have 200mbps and get true speed with no packet loss, but the unreliable connection is concerning since I have a home security system. Update: Almost a year later and still having constant connection issues. I have followed every suggestion on tweaking the settings and it doesn't operate any better than before. I'm really getting tired of it half the time telling me I can't update the firmware while simultaneously booting me from the network so I cannot access the firmware files. Will not buy another ASUS router after this headache.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Stools

customer_reviews.title: Very fast router.  Good for gaming.  Nice Interface
customer_reviews.text: Our old 802.11 b/g/n router was getting a bit old and it was time to upgrade. This unit has FAR more range. Our house is big - 3000 sq feet and there is a lot of brick, etc. For the first time ever, we can be wherever we want and get excellent signal and throughput. It turns out that our Internet is a lot faster than we knew - we get 60 Mbps up and down. And nearly that speed from the deck outside one level downstairs through an exterior wall. Impressive. Gamers will notice a distinct improvement. Of course, wired is best for that, but this is rather impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: 1 Good, Strong, Fast, angry router.
customer_reviews.text: It is a hell of a router. Mine did not get setup right out of the box. I had to go through some settings to be able to get the router working( my cable modem MAC address was the problem). If you are not able to get internet try to restart or master reset your cable modem then the router and modem should pair no problem. I also like the usb 3 in the front of the router, I connected a 32Gb flash memory to my router so I can easily share files between my phone,pc, and MacBook. I am very happy with this router I can easily hit max DL speed on my plan which is 250 Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: ARad

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I don't think anyone should be paying forever for a router from the cable company. You also get better versatility and VPN and IP choices. This and all ASUS routers have an app (download the app!!!! You will need it!!!) that allows you to control your router, change your password, toggle guest mode and monitor who is on your network. It is the latest wifi technology and reasonably priced. Get this along with an ARRIS cable modem and you are ready to go! You save at least $20 a month on your internet bill by having both. Spend the money once and it pays for it self in the first 2 to months. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely buy this router again.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is been running since 9/17/17 with no issues whatsoever on Cox @ ~180-190 Mbps CAT6e, ~160-170 Mbps 5G & ~50-60 Mbps 2.4G (within 5 min of 12/19/17 7PM DSLreports speed test while the wife was streaming Netflix) via an Arris SB6183 16x4 modem. Anywhere between 4 and 8 devices concurrent with no buffering encountered - the 5G rocks & the 2.4G is about as big as that pipe gets. Pushed the 'ol RT-N66U (N900) into WAP mode. Now I'm stepping on all my neighbors' channels ';-] Latest firmware (RT-ACRH13 3.0.0.4_380_8119-gdb642b4.trx 10/24/17) that plugged the WPA2 KRACK hack installed without a hitch. Mucho con gusto!
customer_reviews.author: AZHTfreak

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Ever Had!!
customer_reviews.text: It's the best router I have owned! I know that there are other routers out there that give you more range but hands down this is by far the best I have setup. Belkin, EnGenius, Netgear, Linksys, Cisco, Motorola and a few others.. All that said I was going to purchase the NetGear NightHawk but then I found this one. After seeing the features and then the price I was ready to buy. It just kept getting better because this router kept showing up in Top/Best Router List's all over the web noticed it was in top ten routers list. Look at the comparison charts and ratings and this is the best router for the money. I am pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but no SMB2 protocol
customer_reviews.text: It seems crazy that a modern router doesn't support SMB2. If you don't attach a hard drive to your router as network drive, this isn't an issue for you. However, if you do, you won't be able to connect to that drive from a Windows computer without potentially opening your computer up to future attacks. Windows has disabled the 30 year old protocol SMB1 (that's what this router uses) because it is insecure, so if you want to set up a network drive on this router, you have to re-enable SMB1 on your computer it and keep it re-enabled. I guess I have to hold on to my NAS drive for a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: fzfrank

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Settings for the tech-savvy
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this router for a couple years now. Definitely worth the upgrade. Plenty of settings, some of which surprised me as they are more commercial settings you don't find in a SOHO router. I was able to easily set up a VPN so I can access my home network while I am away, enable QoS so my livestreams take priority, and even set up DDNS so I can always access my network with the same address even though my ISP only gives me a dynamic IP. It also allows you to use the router as a VPN client to have the entirety of your network connect via VPN.
customer_reviews.author: TheCyberQuake

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to use and no issues for us
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up we hooked it up to our cable modem router from spectrum even after moving the router to a different room along with the modem set up was easy and painless if you have any basic internet package this router will be more than enough to suffice the bands are strong and the antennas do you have actual antennas in them if you look at the joints of the antennas you can see the antenna cable changing the network name and password was easy the user interface built into the router is simple and effective this Rider should future-proof us for a good while
customer_reviews.author: mike couzens

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely pleased with this router.
customer_reviews.text: I don't get fancy with my internet equipment, so recently I tried the TP-Link Archer A6, which is currently 45 bucks on Amazon. It bottlenecked my connection to 95 mbps down from the 235 I was getting with only the modem. I installed this little jewel today and the connection is going at full 235 mbps. I am pleased with the purchase and it was a little over 10 bucks more expensive than the first one I got. The interface feels very complete for basic user needs. Overall a great purchase and absolutely recommended if you are looking to have reliable internet and wifi in your home without breaking the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: rlee1089

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I’m a SysAdmin when not doing things I want to do, I also volunteer my computing prowess to some local nonprofits when they need help. Recently a one of their routers crapped the bed, and I replaced it with this unit. For $60 I’d be hard pressed to find a more robust router for home or small business needs (under 10 users) Very easy to navigate settings and set up various aspects of typical routing processes. My one complaint is... it takes FOREVER to reboot 5-10 minutes. I thought it also shat the bed but no, it’s just slow af. But not a deal breaker!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shacklefert

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi router with excellent user control
customer_reviews.text: I'm an IT engineer by trade and love ASUS devices for home/SoHo. This one has been a great addition to our rural home and I chose it specifically because of the cost value and features. USB 3.0 allows for many add-ons, including LTE modems/phone tethering. Signal strength on the 2.4Ghz band is excellent covering all 2000+ sq. ft of single floor interior space and an impressive amount of the outdoor area near the home.The 5Ghz band is good for about half that coverage.
customer_reviews.author: BrianB

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Loads better than my previous TP-Link Archer A7, but not perfect. For one the setup menu defaulted to Chinese. Erm why? When I finally got it figured out, the interface is nice and intuitive. I'm not getting my full gigabit speed but definitely better than the TP-Link which spontaneously shut off and was just overall annoying. Looks sleek and is a small package, overall would recommend in this budget but I will most likely be upgrading to a Ubiquiti Dreammachine.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchit Batra

customer_reviews.title: It does need a better code to overcome these issues
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because, Any changes in any of wifi networks bring down all wifi networks. I has 3 guest 2.4 3 guest 5.0, one non-guest 2.4 and one non-guest 5.0. I keep it because some firewall rules capabilities, so I can set hours for my kids device be able to have any access automatically. Weekdays - At 9pm block all internet access from their ip devices. After 4pm allow access internet Weekends - allow internet 9am to 9pm. I wish it could be done using a calendar where I could add holidays, vacation and school break days. A reboot doesn't work, I need to power off/on. It does need a better code to overcome these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Iamanamazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect performance @ a perfect Price
customer_reviews.text: 3 months of use so far. my device was simple to setup via the app on my S9+ and has remaind perfectly consistent. Router is in the center of my 2500 sq ft home and 5ghz coverage is +/- 5mbps throughout the home. 133mbps at the modemn and 133 on 5ghz. 2.4 is able to reach the end of my 1 acre lot @ 45mbps. I have over 20 devices connected including bluetooth speakers, pcs, game consoles, smart devices plugs and bulbs, even car in the driveway. No connection issues what so ever. I would highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great router. I love the USB with Samba support.
customer_reviews.text: The router works flawlessly and there are plenty of configuration options. The feature I like allot is the USB port that allows me to connect my 8TB USB drive to it via Samba. To use Samba (SMB) , you must also enable the feature in Windows. Each operating system(OS), such as Windows or Linux or lots of other ones you have never heard of has its own way of sharing files that are not compatible with the other OS's. Samba was designed to allow file sharing between different types of operating systems.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R.

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from Service Provider Equipment
customer_reviews.text: This router... For the price... Made a world of difference from the provided router. Speed basically tripled if not more! Mind you, it didn't actually improve my connection speeds, rather it allowed me to take advantage of the bandwidth I pay for. While the provided router topped me at 10mbs on a good day. GUI is awesome and can even be remotely accessed with phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: I found the setup easy enough and there were a lot more options than my previous router in the configuration screens, so it feels like I'm working with a device on a higher tier of professionalism over the WD 750. The signal strength is more than I need, and I can get a solid signal outside of the house on the edge of my property line. I set up multiple SSIDs to give the devices that can handle 802.11ac a dedicated top speed and that has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix14830

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2000 square-foot two-story house
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router out of the box. Moved into a two story 2,000 sq foot house and needed a stronger wifi signal upstairs. I have 100Mbps via Spectrum. Out of the box, I get 100% of my speed on the 5G and 70% on 2G. It fully covers my house. I have it setup in the furtherest corner of the first level and I get 100% speed in every room except the room exactly opposite to the router on the second floor, where I get 50%. Very pleased on day one. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a tech person, so heads up. Setup is par with any other router. ASUS always makes great routers, this one it no exception. Strong signal. I ran out of WiFi channels with just my one ASUS router, so I bought this one and now I never worry about getting booted off for too many connections. Its dual band so you get 5GHz, not much range,but very fast, great no matter where you are in the house, just not if you walk down the block.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Gigabit , VPN, quad-core, for under $60?
customer_reviews.text: Incredible buy for the money, because this is a quad core router! I bought another brand and had to return it because if the VPN went down, it allowed unlimited open access to the internet. That Brand, obviously doesn't understand the importance of a VPN and the absolute need for privacy accompanied with it. This router was purchased to replace an aging Belkin. Only this router and my old Belkin denied access to the internet if the VPN went down. I haven't found another one, another brand, that does the same thing. There may be others out there, but this has not only a quad-core, but it has internal Ram as well. Great media server! Gigabit Ethernet.
customer_reviews.author: MarkJC

customer_reviews.title: ASUS RT-ACRH13 Dual-Band 2x2 AC1300 Wireless Router
customer_reviews.text: This router works very well for a device costing so little $$. It was easy to set up. The connection strength could be better but at this price point it does a very good job. This is a good unit but I would not recommend it be used in a large house having more than one floor or level without noticeable degradation in signal strength. To be fair, at this price point, it still does very well with acceptable bandwidth for video streaming. It has been reliable in operation with no issues. The features it offers at this price point make it worthy of consideration for your wireless network use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S.

customer_reviews.title: it works, but not as well as it could
customer_reviews.text: It works. Plug everything in and we get internet service. However the quality of that service is not what it should be. If I knew how to tweek it, suspect it would perform well however (and here is the real kick in the teeth) it is impossible to get any support from Asus. If you already know everything there is to know about setting up and fine tuning a router, go ahead and buy it. If on the other hand you are the average semi-literate home user,.good luck! Wanted to like it. Feel cheated. WIsh we could give negative stars for (lack of) tech support.
customer_reviews.author: herbert

customer_reviews.title: This is what I call it a PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just rec'd on Sunday 1 PM from Amazon hooked up at 2 PM, I have 22 WiFi devices on my previous network and my WiFi subscription from ISP is max at 100 Mbps, after the set up with ASUS, my wife was in shock, she said her Samsung phone was hooked up at an amazing speed at >700 mbps @ 5GHZ SSID.. I can't believe it...My Ring outdoor Floodlight security camera connected in no time connected to my Netgear extender ( I don't really need an extender) This is a winner for $68.00 OMG.. Love it! An awesome MU-MIMO technology at an affordable price..
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C.

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 12 months
customer_reviews.text: The 5GHz band stopped broadcasting at 9 months, and now the router needs multiple daily reboots to function under normal operating conditions, which usually happen on their own. The most likely cause is cheap memory chips that have gone bad used to store the CAM tables causing overheating and random reboots. But what do I know, I'm just a silly consumer. I will likely upgrade my review depending on the outcome of the RMA process, but there's really no consumer router built for longevity anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Phr0st

customer_reviews.title: Good, Inexpensive Router
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Asus router for one month, and I have been very happy with it. I bought it to replace a more expensive Netgear router that had become unreliable after two years of use. The Asus router has better range, and I have been able to connect my devices to both frequency bands. The 5G band was always a problem with the Netgear. I am very happy so far. We'll see if the Asus is more durable than the Netgear was.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Strong Signal and User Interface
customer_reviews.text: I got this for whole house coverage and it provides a good signal in both 2.4 and 5ghz bands that a prior Verizon Fios provided router did not. I bought this router as part of my switchover to Spectrum. Very easy to setup and was pretty much plug and play. The builtin router interface is nice and provides access to a multitude of features, logs, and bandwidth usage reports. Streams 3-4 shows simultaneously with no issue.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: This router ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. I get coverage all over my house with no dead spots. I was using an Apple Airport Extreme (6th gen) since it came out. I now get the same speeds out of the ASUS AC1300 with double the coverage area. Excellent, affordable upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Guy in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: A little too sensitive when we have storms, has to be reset sometimes, never had a router do that.
customer_reviews.text: It wanted to log in to a web site to do settings and update. I'm not talking about the usual address to connect to a router. That made me feel very nervous about trusting it. Don't like that. They are supposed to be protecting the communications from that router but I just felt wary, still do. It works ok as long as there are no thunderstorms. It works ok but I'm not seeing anything all that special.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Better Product for Half the Price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a $150 Netgear Nighthawk R7000 bought just 9 months ago with this $70 Asus, because the Netgear router kept losing wifi and needed rebooting 5 times a day. This Asus router provides just as good wifi signal and the Asus router admin webpage is far superior. This one doesn't let you use the same name for the 2G and 5G wifi ids, but that's just a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: papaya38

customer_reviews.title: This works so much better than my last WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: I had a Netgear WiFi router before this Asus router and I can tell you that this Asus router works so much better! The old router would randomly drop connections every couple of days on my laptop and I would have to reboot to get the connection going again, I have not had that issue since changing to this Asus router months ago. I have dozens of connections to my router with all of the devices in the house and they are always working great.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Scientist Hut

customer_reviews.title: 1 major flaw
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great in all aspects except one. Whenever I did a file transfer over home network of a Large file (more than 4gb etc) The router block any and all communication from the sending computer until the file transfer is complete. No internet, nothing, can't even access router settings during it. It resumes between files so if you're copying lots of little files it's fine, but since I transfer many large video files it was unusable for me, had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: J. Albaugh

customer_reviews.title: Works great after several months except ethernet
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get my openvpn vpn server running really easily, wifi works great on this device. Easy to configure, although many configuration updates take 90 seconds to finish. After having this router for 2 months the ethernet has stopped working on it. I'm getting a self-assigned ip on any devices connected via ethernet. I guess I might have to place some kind of router/switch before this device to get the ethernet working again... Update now none of the Ethernet ports work. This is now just a piece of junk wifi only router. No way to get internet with Ethernet not working,
customer_reviews.author: wendy funk

customer_reviews.title: Very good, fast router even 40 feet away through concrete block walls.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a visit from my Internet provider who narrowed down my problems to the previous router, a Netgear. He was reading 115 Mbps, while the router was passing only about 80, within 3 feet distance. With the new router I’m getting easily over 100 Mb per second even 40 feet away. Set up was fairly easy. I cannot comment on Customer Support because I haven’t needed it. Overall, very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbo

customer_reviews.title: Solid, reliable
customer_reviews.text: Using this for a couple months. Very reliable. Nice GUI - you can track the devices connected to the router via integrated website, and even update the logos of the devices. The GUI has a lot of features, that I may have played with in my younger days. Now I just want the thing to work, and the ASUS router has definitely satisfied that requirement. Through ~2 walls: 2.4GHz peaks out around ~50Mbps, shows up as full strength on Windows Wifi logo. 5GHz reaches around 130Mbps, shows up as 2 of 4 based on the Windows Wifi logo.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sun

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Didn't work with my IP cameras
customer_reviews.text: Worse than I thought: In 2.4GHz, signal is weak and drops below the point where it's useless to my IP cameras and other IP appliances. ---- I bought this specifically to serve my indoor/outdoor IP cameras. Two of my 8 cams could not synch with this unit. Plus, despite the four antennae and advertised range, the signal went no further than my plain old 2010 Netgear. I put my old Netgear back in service and took this unit out. So, don't now how good this unit really is. Tip for use with older cams: disable 5Ghz radio.
customer_reviews.author: velgerbgarb

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and affordable router
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and affordable router! I love the USB 3.0 connection which allows me to hook my external hard drive to it and use it as another storage device. It's like my own personal server or what we call it nowadays; "cloud". So when you want to clean out your old files and put it on the external hard drive to make your laptop or desktop run faster; you can always access those old files through your "cloud". Your own network drive shows up with ease on next to the C:drive. Good job ASUS and I've recommend the whole FAM and my clients to get connected!
customer_reviews.author: skriLLah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router for the price
customer_reviews.text: My previous router was the d-link dir-825 which served me well. Upgrading to this was a night and day difference! Wireless signal became significantly stronger around the home, and my download speeds increased SIGNIFICANTLY! This router has just about everyone anyone really needs. Most of all, I love the QOS feature and capability. You can set the download & upload limit on users so you can distribute bandwidth accordingly. I never deal w/ slowdowns on any device, EVER, because of this. Awesome device, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for money
customer_reviews.text: Good value but seems to be a buggy. First off, expect half of what are the stated speeds. At most, the fast speed I could get 500 Mbps over wifi when the laptop was directly next to the router. The external USB 3.0 port is a nice feature to use as a mock NAS though transfer speeds were horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sam Wise

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit ?
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my speed to handle 1 gig, so I bought this router for my home. The moment I set it up and everything was hooked up my internet was slower. My WiFi wasn't stable, I hooked up my old router and everything went back to normal. I tried to contact tech support but it was closed 30 min before their listed times. This is the last ASUS product I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff k

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Asus wifi router, setup is very easy. signal strength is good. So far no issues. This is good for 2 story home. As I have basement too, so using my old asus wifi router as repeater to get the signals in basement. 04/13/2020: After upgrading to latest firmware, 5G connection keeps dropping, changed it to different channels, but no success. Returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: AY

customer_reviews.title: We have an IPv6 winner
customer_reviews.text: After trying two different Netgear routers, both with different firmware bugs that kept IPv6 from working properly, I decided it was time to try a different brand. And I'm really impressed. This router has a web interface that feels modern and responsive, IPv6 works great without​having to flash third party firmware, it's affordable, and it has enough range to check email not just anywhere in the house but across the street in my neighbor's driveway. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H

customer_reviews.title: An excellent less expensive Asus router
customer_reviews.text: My expensive Asus router $300+ died 28 months after purchase. I purchased this model and discovered it worked better. I bought a second one and set it up as an access point. For the price of one expensive router I now have two (at a lower cost) with better wifi coverage and improved performance. Note: I used CAT6e cable from the router to the access point to maximize RF signal in the house - inside and out.
customer_reviews.author: WBOAOD

customer_reviews.title: Been using this for the past 3 years!!! Works great !!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded my Xfinity Internet to a higher speed configuration and was checking my past amazon order to see if my router would support it... Guess what? It not only supports but has much higher speeds as well... The dual-band is great and I have been using this router for the last 3 years and so far no issues and performs really well... I connect lots of devices (10+) and we are as family heavy on streaming or watching videos for the most part... This router hands well... For the features it provides, the cost is pretty low in my opinion, and probably gives those 'high-end' routers a run for its money. IMHO a great product and possibly more... Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ramkumar Sridharan

customer_reviews.title: I've bought 2 and soon to buy a third
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my fiances dying wifi router. This one has such better speeds, but more importantly it has much better range. This thing reaches 30 feet out her house and down a 10 foot or so hill to her community pool! I then bought one to replace my own aging wifi router, and it works great in my house too. I will soon either buy one for my parents or get them to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: david bozanic

customer_reviews.title: Works great after several tries at setup.
customer_reviews.text: I have configured numerous wireless routers. This needed to be an access point so setup was cut and try but successful after the third method. This unit replaces the TP-Link AC1900 Desktop Wi-Fi Range Extender RE590T. Again I had to give up on a WIfi extender. I connected the ASUS with Ethernet cable. It runs my devices at speeds between 400 and 867 bps on 5G.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Danko

customer_reviews.title: Great router for a family with on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I loved the price, for $45 when on sale I was able to get a reliable and easy to use wireless router. I told spectrum to kick rocks. Setup is easy and a person who understands little can do it. I have noticed a significant improvement of coverage and speed throughout my home. My house is 2200 square feet and it works well throughout.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Roque

customer_reviews.title: Great Router Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my Grandmother who doesn't use it personally but her home health care staff and visitors do. Her old WiFi router was about 10 years old. We noticed a great increase in range and speed right out of the box. What it was configured with proper QOS it was even better. The set up took less than 5 minutes and we had everyone online and working within minutes. Great Product for the money. Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hopey42107

customer_reviews.title: The instructions were pretty easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to cover wifi at the front of our house, because the modem wifi supplied with the provider doesn't do well at the front of our house. The instructions were pretty easy to follow, it was quick and easy to get set up and we have no problem getting wifi to the front of the house now. We run the firestick off of it and don't have any problem streaming movies, even with other devices using internet on it. Thought it was worth the price and are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: SNTM

customer_reviews.title: Plagued by 5G issues such as dissapearing WiFi and having to restart several times a week
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this router. It was such an easy setup and it worked right off the bat. However, I have had nothing but issues with the 5G band where it would randomly disappear and any device connected to it is immediately disconnected. Afterwards, the 5G is not visible at all and the only thing you can do is restart the router. This is happening several times a week. After researching this, it appears that it is a very common problem with this router. I would NOT be buying this ever again and I would only recommend it if you do not care about using the 5G.
customer_reviews.author: Georgi

customer_reviews.title: PORT FOWARDING DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Despite this being an issue for three years with various Asus routers, port forwarding still does not work as of April 2019. If all you need is a wireless access point, this is a mediocre router but will get the job done. If you need port forwarding for gaming or small office use, look elsewhere. It simply does not work on this router, as so many reviewers here have complained.
customer_reviews.author: A Warm, Close, Personal Friend of Al

customer_reviews.title: I got 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: 1 I use as the router and it is really loaded up at times. It gets real erratic all the time but it always clears up after a proper pull of the plug or sometimes a gentle reboot. the 2nd one is across the street and is simply an AP point. I rarely needs a boot in the rear butt occasionally it gets one. So I give it a 4 and it acts just about like all the other routers.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Matters

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This router covers my whole house and was so easy to set up. I appreciate that the GUI is simple and old-school.. "If it ain't broke, don't fix it." The newer routers have more "streamlined"-appearing interfaces, but I find them frustrating to use because they take a lot of the autonomy out of setting up our router if that makes sense - anyway I appreciate this router because it's fast, has lots of range, and was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Carlene

customer_reviews.title: support does not respond to emails.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but the interface can be confusing. I had a problem in the beginning and support never bothered to respond to my manual sent email. Their automatic email report system and update system does not work. I manually found their update software online and installed. It fix my problem and their email system also with no thanks to them.
customer_reviews.author: DonM

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This router worked great for over 2 years but the past few months there have been stability and connection issues. I am not sure if these are related to recent firmware updates or the extra traffic from additional devices due to work and school at home. I think it would be a great router for one or two people just not a family.
customer_reviews.author: zd

customer_reviews.title: Dead Router
customer_reviews.text: The router died soon after being installed, but unfortunately was not powered up until a few days after Amazon's return window. Asus determined the router was defective. Amazon connected me with Asus who offered to replace router or have me send defective router in for repair. 2 Year Warranty. The first option required a credit card number with a hold for the amount of the purchase price which would be lifted once the defective router was shipped to Asus. Amazon tech help stayed on line (much appreciated) throughout my conversation with Asus rep, who was a bit unclear about resolution process. I will update once I receive replacement router.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Although there is a set up wizard, it was not really needed because as soon as I connected up the equipment the speed test already had me at the rated ISP speed of 200 Mbit down and 20 Mbit up (216 Mbit and 21Mbit measured) and you can change the router login as soon as you do the initial default login, then you are presented with an interface that allows you to change your WIFI passwords and security protocols right there. You simply hit apply after entering the information you want to change and poof, both 2.4 and 5 G WIFI available to all my devices. There are 4 available ports for wiring up your desktop machines.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin E. Blevins

customer_reviews.title: 2.4ghz side works well, but the 5mhz side does not.
customer_reviews.text: It works well in 2.4ghz, but every time I try to connect a 5mhz device, it starts the router into a cycle of rebooting, and the thing takes about 2 minutes to reboot and come back. Frustrating. I checked, and the software is up to date. My phone is the only thing that connects on 5ghz, so setting it to the 2.4ghz side made the rebooting problem stop. Also, I tried plugging a WD My Passport 2gig drive into the USB port and that shut the router down hard. But I plugged an old, powered WD My Book into the USB and it worked just fine. You have to FTP into it.
customer_reviews.author: Populo Iratus

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME ROUTER!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. Best bang for your buck on MU-MIMO routers. Others sell for $200+. I went from an AC1200 router averaging 10-20mb/sec download speed and 3-4mb/s upload that was very sensitive to network traffic to this where I always am at 60mb/s download and 12-15mb/s upload speed. It's range is unbeatable. It has every option all if the more expensive routers have and I actually saw it for $50 on a lightning deal. But I paid normal price which is fine considering that its worth every penny. Range works great in 5,000sq ft home. And it's not big at all.
customer_reviews.author: Real_Jonathan_ G

customer_reviews.title: terrific little router.
customer_reviews.text: arrived promptly and well packaged as usual from Amazon. I paired it up with an Engenius WDS Access Point out side with an attached antenna off my shop. Setup took a bit of time but pretty straightforward. Asus does a good job of their interface. One little surprise (I knocked off one star) The four antenna on the router are swivel sockets (plastic), no sma screw connectors! I had to add a a pigtail to both sides of the existing antenna (2x2 means 2-2.4GHz and 2-5GHz) for my dual band AP. Other than that little surprise everything is Okee Dokee.
customer_reviews.author: Threefold Lotus Kwoon

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless WIFI unit!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to setup and connect, program and secure! Well worth the ASUS trust and purchase. ASUS make great devices! I had a prior ASUS wireless router that was 50mbs, had to move up to 1gbs for my new cable connection so I bought this device. I also have ASUS monitor and ASUS wifi pci dual band 1gbs card for my pc. Great products!
customer_reviews.author: Just Monitoring

customer_reviews.title: Uhhhh...I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.text: ASUS RT-ACRH13 Dual-Band 2x2 AC1300 Wifi 4-port Gigabit Router with USB 3.0 When it worked, it flew. But just shy of 3 months, and we've got problems. Something went wrong with my encrypted communications with pop & smtp servers. So, I reflashed the BIOS & reconfigured ... that fix lasted for about 4 hours, then same problem. It took me several hours to narrow it down to the router, major PIA. I'm past 30 days, so back to the factory she goes. I'll update when I get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: TripleTap

customer_reviews.title: Great router with easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Just got this router and was able to get it setup and configure in about 10 minutes. Was having an issue with my 4 year old TP-Link router giving us less than half our internet speed and just plain not working for some apps. This router instantly boosted us up to our max speed so very happy. Will update this review should anything change but at least the first impression is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Delafosse

customer_reviews.title: Decent price, but not long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: While this device worked, it worked pretty well and was fairly easy to setup. Mostly plug and play to get started, and the router gives you a router DNS alias for your router settings to make things easy. The interface is a bit clunky and outdated, but gets the job done. Bought this router on December 30, 2017. Been using it through to now, although partway through the middle of 2020 the wifi signal became spotty and started dropping outright for up to an hour or so. Wired connection continued to work, but upload speeds began to be very slow on it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Tse

customer_reviews.title: Decent router for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for over a year now and the main draw for me was the advertised large wifi range it is supposed to have. Well the range is no better than my previous Linksys router I had and now the past few months the connection to it has been getting worse and worse. I was hoping this would last me longer than it did but I might have to start looking for another, more powerful one as this one is just barely cutting it. If you don't need to have a larger wifi coverage area this is definitely the way to go however, I was just hoping for a stronger signal than what I am getting.
customer_reviews.author: Shopey

customer_reviews.title: MU-MIMO is a real thing!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 200 megabit plan. With multiple devices connected and my $5/month spectrum router, one device would get 150 mbps down while another device gets 30 mbps. After getting this router, both devices get 230 mbps simultaneously. Note that prices fluctuate - this router already went up $2 since i purchased it. One pic is a galaxy s9, other is my macbook pro
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Disposable. Replace every 6 months for semi reliable signal
customer_reviews.text: You may get up to 9 months before the daily network disconnections start on the 5k band. Make sure this is in a handy place to hit the restart button on the back, everyday. Update - completely non operational after a couple weeks of daily outages. GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.author: Erich Weber

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router.
customer_reviews.text: Why spend $300 on a router if you can get almost the same performance from a $70 router? I've compared this router to another brand's $300 router and could hardly note any differences. This one has a good range and can easily handle 20+ devices connected at the same time. 5GHz has markedly less range than 2.4GHz. This is good because your neighbor's 5GHz cannot enter your house and mess up your WiFi! Gigabit wired speed is crucial if your Internet service is above 100Mbps. Very stable too, no restarts necessary in three months. Don't forget to protect your routers and modems with surge protectors. Trust me, one lightning can cause a LOT of damage, not to mention Internet downtime.
customer_reviews.author: The Long Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Bought Renewed version
customer_reviews.text: No problems whatsoever with install and functionality. I though the signal strength would be a little better. I live in a two story townhouse 1,300SF and if I close the door on the most far end of my place I drop signal once in a while. Since I bought a renewed device at almost half the list price I think it’s worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: YokT

customer_reviews.title: Range is phenomenal.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for nearly a year now, paired with a regular old 8x4 DOCSIS 3 modem. A bit of a silly combination, as we only have 100Mb Internet service, why would we need a router like this? Well, the range. The range is nothing short of phenomenal. Throughout the house, in the yard, in the basement, in the garage, it pegs our 100 Mb speed cap no matter where you are. Very, very worth the investment. We used to not be able to use our Fire TV in the rec room, now it has full signal. Cannot recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I know this isn’t the best router out there, but for the money it will provide a strong, reliable, and fast signal when compared to routers around the same price. I don’t personally use this router, but I have bought this one for 3 people and everytime the signal is better, they reach full throughput that they are paying for, and all the others issues disappear. Again, this isn’t the newest, latest and greatest, but it’s awesome for what you pay. I would recommend this router to anyone, especially with how easy it is to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: best wifi router
customer_reviews.text: very good quality very good performance and signal the dual band is very useful for my 2 desktops , 2 smart tv's and smart phone i am using it in a 3 story apartment building with 43 residents and have never had an interference problem additionally it works well throughout my apartment thru several solid walls
customer_reviews.author: BILL

customer_reviews.title: Really weak 2G signal, respectable 5G signal, perfect LAN speed
customer_reviews.text: On a Suddenlink gigabit internet connection, it managed to ouput 900 Mbps wired to my laptop. On 5G it gave an output of 350-600 Mbps just next to the router while on 2G it only managed to give an output of 100 Mbps. 2G signal is barely useful beyond the adjacent room of the router but the 5G signal was able to provide 100+ Mbps throughout the two-bedroom apartment. Update: By keeping the router on a 6 feet high shelf instead of the carpet, the signal strength and range were boosted considerably from 100+ Mbps to 200+ Mbps throughout the apartment on 5G.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

product_meta.title: ASUS Dual-Band 2x2 AC1300 Super-Fast WiFi 4-Port Gigabit Router with MU-MIMO and USB 3.0 (RT-ACRH13)
product_meta.description: Style:Dual-Band AC1300 w/Gb LAN| Pattern Name:RouterUpgrade to AC Wi-Fi for your bandwidth-hungry devices with the Dual-Band ASUS RT-ACRH13. Phones and tablets are free to roam throughout the home thanks to four external antennas that enhance coverage and stability. Easy, intuitive setup and network management are at your fingertips with ASUSWRT and the ASUS router app. Actual data throughput and Wi-Fi coverage will vary from network conditions and environmental factors, including the volume of network traffic, building material and construction, and network overhead, result in lower actual data throughput and wireless coverage. Power Supply - AC Input - 110V~240V(50~60Hz), DC Output - 12 V with max. 1.5 A current
feature_bullets: Dual band AC1300 with the latest 2x2 MU MIMO technology for combined speeds of up to 1267 Mbps
4 external 5dBi antennas for improved Wi Fi range and multi device performance; Connected devices must be 802.11ac compatible for best results
Monitor and manage your network with ease from your mobile device using the intuitive ASUS Router App
Encryption: 64 bit WEP, 128 bit WEP, WPA2 PSK, WPA PSK, WPA Enterprise , WPS support
Effortless router setup with the ASUSWRT web based interface, Super Fast Wi Fi: Dual band 802.11ac Wi Fi with concurrent speeds up to 867Mbps (5GHz) and 400Mbps (2.4GHz)

Integrated USB 3.0 port allows you to share external drives/flash drives with your network; OS Support Windows 10, 8, 8.1, 7, Mac OS X 10.1, 10.4, 10.5, 10.6, 10.7, 10.8; Operation mode Wireless router mode, Access point mode

specifications.Operating System: Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 7, Mac OS X 10.1, Mac OS X 10.4, Mac OS X 10.4, Mac OS X 10.5, Mac OS X 10.6, Mac OS X 10.7, Mac OS X 10.8
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,441 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
